sources.title: The Montana Kid
sources.description: A cowboy whose friend has been swindled out of his ranch and then murdered must take care of the man's son, then he goes after the killers.

sources.title: The Montana Kid (1931) BILL CODY
sources.description:
Stars: Bill Cody, Andy Shuford, Doris Hill 
 Director: Harry L. Fraser

 A cowboy whose friend has been swindled out of his ranch and then murdered must take care of the man's son, then he goes after the killers.

TRIVIA: Born William Joseph Cody on January 5, 1891, in St. Paul, Minnesota, he became a popular cowboy star during the 1920s and 1930s. Cody is often associated with the B-Western genre, where he played the heroic cowboy figure, a staple of American cinema during that period.

metadata.Plot: Larson cheats Burke at cards, has him sign over the deed to his ranch disguised as an IOU, and then kills him in a supposedly fair gunfight. This sends Bill Denton into action and he robs Larson and his henchman Gabby until he has enough money to buy back the ranch. When Larson realizes he received his own money back, both Larson and his men and the Marshal go after Denton.
metadata.Writer: Harry L. Fraser, George Arthur Durlam
metadata.Actors: Bill Cody, Andy Shuford, Doris Hill
